snippet: A proposal for a high-voltage conduit from wind farms in the north to the industrial south has aroused not-in-my-backyard opposition.
abstract: Network providers present proposal for 800-kilometer, or 500-mile, corridor in Germany of high-voltage power lines, carrying electricity from wind turbines; many Germans balk at idea of power lines running through their backyards and fields around their communities.
lead_paragraph: A proposal for a high-voltage conduit from wind farms in the north to the industrial south has aroused not-in-my-backyard opposition.

headline.main: Germany’s Clean-Energy Plan Faces Resistance to Power Lines
headline.print_headline: Cost of Power Grid’s Growth Makes Some Germans Wary
